intro: Lindelofia stylosa, commonly known as the slender-stemmed lindelofia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Lindelofia stylosa typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as coastal areas and disturbed soils. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in warm, humid climates.
